describe: Grenada, known as the 'Spice Isle', is a Caribbean country comprising the main island, also called Grenada, and smaller surrounding islands. It's famous for its nutmeg and mace production, lush landscapes, and beautiful beaches.

cities.name: üèù St. George's
cities.geographical_location: Located on the southwestern coast of Grenada, St. George's is the capital city.
cities.climate: Tropical climate with a wet season from June to December and a dry season from January to May.
cities.famous_cuisine: Oil Down, a hearty stew made with salted meat, breadfruit, and coconut milk.

cities.name: üèù Gouyave
cities.geographical_location: Situated on the western coast of Grenada, known for its fishing industry.
cities.climate: Tropical climate with consistent temperatures year-round and a distinct wet and dry season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Fish Friday, a weekly street festival featuring fresh seafood.

cities.name: üèù Grenville
cities.geographical_location: Located on the eastern coast of Grenada, it's the second-largest town on the island.
cities.climate: Tropical climate with a wet season and a dry season, similar to the rest of the island.
cities.famous_cuisine: Callaloo soup, a dish made with leafy greens and often served with crab.
